questions.prompt: Write the syntax for creating an array with values 'Sports', 'Cooking', 'Reading'.
questions.explanation: Arrays are created with square brackets and comma-separated values.

questions.prompt: How do you access the first element of the hobbies array?
questions.explanation: Array indices start at 0, so hobbies[0] is 'Sports'.

questions.prompt: Which method adds 'Working' to the end of the hobbies array?
questions.explanation: push() appends a new element to the end of an array.

questions.prompt: Which method removes the last element from the numbers array?
questions.explanation: pop() removes the last element of an array.

questions.prompt: Which method removes the first element from the numbers array?
questions.explanation: shift() removes the first element of an array.

questions.prompt: Which method adds 20 to the end of the numbers array?
questions.explanation: push() appends a new element to the end.

questions.prompt: Which method adds 2 to the beginning of the numbers array?
questions.explanation: unshift() adds a new element to the front of an array.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for finding the index of 'Sports' in hobbies using findIndex with a function body.
questions.explanation: findIndex executes the function for each item until it returns true.

questions.prompt: Write the shorter syntax for finding the index of 'Sports' in hobbies using findIndex.
questions.explanation: Arrow functions can omit braces and return for single expressions.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for mapping hobbies to a new array with an exclamation mark added to each item.
questions.explanation: map() transforms each item and returns a new array.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for mapping hobbies to a new array of objects with a text property.
questions.explanation: Wrap object literals in parentheses when returning implicitly from arrow functions.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for filtering even numbers from the array numbers.
questions.explanation: filter() returns a new array with elements that pass the test.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for reducing the array numbers to their sum.
questions.explanation: reduce() accumulates values into a single result.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for checking if any number in numbers is greater than 10.
questions.explanation: some() returns true if at least one element passes the test.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for checking if all numbers in numbers are even.
questions.explanation: every() returns true if all elements pass the test.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for checking if hobbies includes 'Cooking'.
questions.explanation: includes() checks if an array contains a value.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for finding the first number greater than 10 in numbers.
questions.explanation: find() returns the first element that matches the condition.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for flattening a nested array one level deep.
questions.explanation: flat() flattens nested arrays into a single array.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for accessing the last element of numbers using at().
questions.explanation: at() allows negative indices to access from the end.

questions.prompt: Write the syntax for creating a sorted copy of numbers without mutating the original.
questions.explanation: toSorted() returns a new sorted array, leaving the original unchanged.
